sentences.sContent: If the issuer decides to prepay the bonds, the issuer must pay a premium.
sentences.sContent_eng: If the issuer decides to prepay the bonds, the issuer must pay a premium.
sentences.sCn: 如果发行方决定提前支付债券，就必须支付贴补利息。

sentences.sContent: There are those who prepare their income taxes in February, prepay mortgages and serve precisely planned dinners at an ungodly 6:30 p. m.
sentences.sContent_eng: There are those who prepare their income taxes in February, prepay mortgages and serve precisely planned dinners at an ungodly 6:30 p. m.
sentences.sCn: 有些人二月份九准备好交个人所得税，预先偿还抵押借款，按计划准时在常人难以忍受的六点半开饭；

words.tran: 预付（prepay的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to pay for something before you need it or use it
